title: Sinead O’Connor Mourned in Irish Mountain Village Where She Once Lived
description: For three years, the singer, who died this week, found simplicity and happiness in a mountain sanctuary where she was just another neighbor.

title: Ukraine’s Counteroffensive Makes Some Gains, but Questions Remain
description: Kyiv has intensified its counteroffensive against the Russian invasion, but has kept things murky on the size of the assault, the casualties and what forces it still has in reserve.

title: Putin claims Russian lines are holding.
Putin, at Summit With African Leaders, Casts West as Mutual Foe
description: At a summit in St. Petersburg, Russia, President Vladimir V. Putin offered free grain as he sought to shore up ties with the continent. But lower-than-hoped-for attendance among African leaders hinted at tempering support.

title: Putin’s Promise of Free Grain Reflects Russia’s Priorities in Africa
description: The Russian leader made the overture days after pulling out of the Black Sea grain deal that benefited many countries on the continent.

title: Photos Suggest Prigozhin Is in Russia, Meeting African Officials
description: The whereabouts of the leader of the Wagner mercenary group has been a subject of continuing questions since an aborted mutiny last month.

title: Oppenheimer and the Chain Reactions of Our Own Making
description: The film “Oppenheimer” is not just about the life of a man central to the atomic bomb project: It tells a story of ambition and petty grievances spiraling out of anyone’s control.

title: Where Wildfires Are Raging in Europe and North Africa
description: Firefighters have scrambled to extinguish blazes in at least 10 countries as a heat wave has swept the Mediterranean region. Here’s what to know.

title: King Charles Doesn’t Have as Many Swans as He Used to
description: For hundreds of years, the royal family has laid claim to many of England’s swans. An annual count found a worrisome drop in cygnets along a stretch of the River Thames this year.

title: Plan Touching Netanyahu Corruption Case Angers Israel’s Opposition
description: The corruption case against Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is overseen by the attorney general. Lawmakers in his party proposed changing her role, prompting anger and a swift reversal.

title: Niger Coup: What to Know
description: Military mutineers said that they had ousted the country’s elected leader. The move shakes a pillar of democracy in West Africa.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Bombards Southern Ukraine, Trying to Keep Kyiv’s Advance at Bay
description: Moscow launched airstrikes and artillery barrages in the south, where U.S. officials said Ukraine had begun the main thrust of its counteroffensive.

title: Putin Promises Free Grain at Africa Summit, Aiming to Help Russia’s Image
description: At a summit for African countries, the Russian president insisted that Western hypocrisy rather than his invasion of Ukraine was to blame for disruptions in the global food supply.

title: How Russia’s State Media Describes Life In Occupied Crimea
description: Since Russia invaded Ukraine last year, Russian government officials and state television have hammered home the message that everything is fine.

title: After Ousting Qin Gang, China Erases Him and Evades Questions
description: China blasted “malicious hype” around the abrupt removal of Qin Gang. The Foreign Ministry’s fumbling response pointed to its diminished influence under Xi Jinping.

title: Niger’s Detained President Vows to Save Democracy From Coup
description: A group of soldiers claimed to have seized power in Niger. But President Mohamed Bazoum and his allies insist the coup could still be reversed.

title: Once Wary, Biden to Host Italy’s Meloni at the White House
description: President Biden had feared the electoral victory of Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s far-right party last fall would spell trouble. But she has proved to be a strong ally in the American-led effort to support Ukraine.

title: North Korea Vows Support for Moscow in Visit by Russian Delegation
description: Pyongyang vowed increased military cooperation against the United States, a common enemy, during a visit by Russia’s defense minister.

title: South Korea Unveils Truman Statue on Armistice Anniversary
description: Conservatives appreciate Truman’s decision to send U.S. troops to fight for their country in the Korean War.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Ukraine begins the “big test” of its counteroffensive

title: Photos: The Korean War, 70 Years After the Armistice
description: American troops led United Nations forces to defend South Korea against the North. The war ended with a cease-fire agreement and a Korean Peninsula that is still divided.

title: Life Under U.K. Russia Sanctions: Chauffeurs, Chefs and More
description: Despite tough talk, Britain’s new sanctions program against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has proved shaky. Some oligarchs have received generous exemptions. Officials have at times overreached.

title: Biden and Meloni of Italy May Find Common Ground
description: The president has been wary of the Italian prime minister’s hard-right politics. But when they meet on Thursday, they may see eye to eye on key issues.

title: Military in Niger Announces Coup After Soldiers Detain President
description: President Mohamed Bazoum was one of the West’s most reliable partners in a volatile region threatened by militant extremists and prone to coups.
